name: the Broken Issue
description:
The new issue of Article takes on what it means for something to be 'Broken'. It's timely. Watch the news, read the papers, listen to people talk in the pub: The whole world is going to shit, and no-one is really doing anything about it, apparently. 

With this as a backdrop features in the  issue include a photo-series by Edmund Clark rebuilding scenes from the Falkland's war, an in depth interview with Jeremy Hutchinson about his project Err, looks at wasteland twinning, the history of ruin porn, and the first of Bill Drummond's last twenty five interviews - ever!

84 pages of mixed print B5

Order now for dispatch on April 18th

Free shipping to the UK

name: ROTHERHAM IS THE NEW BERLIN
description: Inspired by recent pronouncements on the state of the north, this shirt is our best ever seller. A meaningful meaningless slogan screen printed onto heavy cotton t-shirts. How can you say no?

name: Vol 2 Back Issues
description:
Back Issues from Article Vol 2, Summer 2010 - Present.

Select from:
Issue 0 - The Copy Issue.
The first issue of Article Vol 2. looked at the influence of Copying on creative practices. A series of interviews including the Designers Republic, Norsea Industries, Nous Vous, and Manzine looked at stealing ideas. Features examined City Branding, the impact of the internet on Street Art, making gaming real with Live Action Role Play, and forgery in Art Practice in a feature on Darko Maver. The issue's photoshoot was also made entirely on a photocopier. 4,000 copies of the issue were distributed between Sheffield, Nottingham, Leeds, Liverpool and Manchester.

Issue 1 - The Drift Issue
Drifting, going off topic and losing focus; the theme behind the second issue of Vol 2. Features included how to Drift Through Life, guidelines on how to take a Situationist walk through a city, the pressure on moving to London when you finish university, the wistful nature of documentary film making, and piece of the hobo lifestyle. The issue also included interviews with The Hundred in the Hands, Human, Mercy and Ok Parking. The issue's photoshoot took on a vagrant theme and was shot by Jodie Blackburn in Sheffield's industrial no-man's land.
We printed 4,000 copies of the issue, 600 of which were distributed on the STACK Magazine service.

Issue 2  - Cities
The third of issue of Article Vol 2 looked at cities in the North of England. The issue contained features on the notion of liveable cities, the architectural legacy of J.L. Womersley, if there is such an thing as Northernism, and an interview with legendary designer Peter Saville on the merits of civic branding. The issue included illustrations by Nick Deakin, and photography from Jodie Blackburn and Preston is My Paris. In the regular music section there was also an interview with James Murphy of LCD Soundsystem. 6,000 copies of the issue were distributed across the country.

name: Brutal Tea Towel Black
description:
Since we’ve started this magazine, Park Hill has regularly featured in our pages. Living in Sheffield, the epic weight of the concrete megastructure is an inescapable part of the city’s landscape. Its sprawling grid structure, which rises above the train station, is one of the first things anyone sees when first visiting Sheffield, and is easily one of the most interesting and imposing buildings in the city.

This memorabilia celebrates the raw, imposing structure, and also its status as a listed piece of English Heritage. 

These tea towels are printed in Sheffield with Earth Positive ink on organic calico.

name: Robin Beck T-Shirt For Article
description:
Based on original image from Larry Clark's 'Tulsa' (1971)

Limited Edition Screen Printed Tee 

Designed by Robin Beck

100% Cotton and all that
Available Small, Large and a few XLs
Medium is sold out.

name: Article Vol 1 Issue 13
description:
Issue 13: May 2010. The final issue of volume one, 13 was the Synesthesia Issue, and was made in collaboration with Sensoria Festival. Features looked at sound based synesthesia, wax cylinder recordings, extra-sensory perception, police dog training and sensory deprivation. Also included are interviews with British Sea Power, Shaun Bloodworth, Rachel Koolen, and the Black Dog.
Tabloid magazine, full colour, 64pp
50 copies of 2000 Left

name: Article Vol 1 Issue 12
description:
Issue 12: March 2010. After nearly two years of producing and A5 B&W magazine, the decision was taken to do a big one, in colour. So, Article 12, the Leisure Issue, was printed as a full colour tabloid newspaper. Features looked at shopping centres, binge drinking, finding sexual partners on Craig's List, Estonian avant garde DIY, and a section on underrated hobbies. Also included were interviews with Debruit and Rudi Zygadlo.
Full Colour Tabloid, 32pp
50 copies of 2000 left

name: Article Vol 1 Issue 11
description:
Issue 11: February 2010. The Waste issue includes infographics on how we waste time, and features on Cultural Recycling, the destruction of Sheffield's former central fire station, Berlin's garbage disposal service branding. The issue's lead feature recounts an adventure with Sheffield artist Phlegm taking the writer around some of his favourite hidden spot, with a series exclusive photos taken by Theo Simpson. The issue also included interviews with geographer Anna Minton, Artistic Director of the Crucible theatre Daniel Evans, and dark indie outfit Ebsen and the Witch.
A5 - B&W, 40pp
ONLY 4 of 1000 LEFT !!!!

name: Article Vol 1 Issue 10
description:
Issue 10: December 2010. This Security themed issue of Article includes features on Kid Acne, the infamous Niche nightclub in Sheffield, Ferris Wheels, Community Support Officers, and the value of interactive advertising. There are also interviews with photographer Jim Brodgen, and artistic duo FrenchMottershead.
A5 - B&W, 48pp
44 copies of 1000 left

name: Article Vol 1 Issue 9
description:
Issue 9: November 2009. A feature heavy issue, Nine included pieces about late eighties civic architecture, the use of public intellectuals, the American Dream, and if there is such a thing as Gay Geography. Also included are interviews with Boy 8-Bit, and Neon Indian.
A5 - B&W, 48pp
10 copies of 1000 left

name: Article Vol 1 Issue 7
description:
Issue 7: Summer 2009, the only issue of ARTICLE to include no advertising. Issue seven was printed on a minuscule budget, made up of four folded A3 sheets that can be arranged into an A1 poster. It is printed in Black and Cyan. The issue was never distributed and mainly given out to friends. The content includes a series of infographics about the hilly-ness of European cities, and the correlation to their relative coolness. There are further features about Public Art, Regeneration, Morris Dancing, as well as interviews with Joe & Will Ask, Telepathe and Blue Sabbath Black Fiji. Easily one of my favourite issues!
4 x A3 sheets folded to A5. Cyan and Black printing. 
20 copies of 200 left

name: Article Vol 1 Issue 5
description:
Issue 5: Winter 2008, the issue was the third to printed in classic Article format. B&W A5 zine with a card cover. Features included stories about Irish language summer camps, Ghanain Hip Hop, Music genre nomenclature, and the Israeli Army's approach to urban planning. 
A5 - B&W with 16pp Cyan. 48pp. 
17 copies of 600 left

name: Article Vol 1 Issue 1
description:
Issue 1: Released in April 2008, when we were still so young, this magazine hardly resembles the Article as it is now. It's a great read though, with features on Dildos, Drugs, Pommegranates, Cadbury's and fashion. 
A4 - B&W, 36pp glossy. 
20 Copies of 400 left
